stadium.name: The Serpent's Pass
stadium.location: Zmeigorod, just west of the lumber mill
stadium.description: Has to be periodically rebuilt whenever the old stadium starts sinking into the swamp. Don’t worry about it.

stats.pregame_ritual: Rubbing a foul-smelling local mushroom on their elbows for flexibility.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Polishing their helmet with a live snail for good luck.
Tensing every muscle in their body at once, then releasing.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Looking each teammate in the eye and giving a single, firm nod.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Painting a single, matching stripe of mud on each player's face.

stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

preGame:
Step right up, ladies and gentlemen, ghouls and ghosts! Welcome to the spectacular opening of the Osterra Playoffs! Nok the Corrupter here, coming to you live from the soggy, sinking Serpent's Pass! We've got a real humdinger today as the popular local favorites, the Zmeigorod Snessengers, host those wood-walking warriors, Oak & Onslaught! This is Game 1 of a Best of 3 series, folks, and the stakes are higher than a mountain giant on stilts! The loser gets booted to the loser's bracket, and nobody wants that kind of shame hanging over their head!

The atmosphere here is simply electric—or maybe that's just the lightning from the Sudden Downpour we're expecting! The fans are packed in like sardines, and let me tell you, the Zmeigorod faithful are out in force! You can barely hear yourself think over the roar of the crowd. The Snessengers are the darlings of the realm right now, while Oak & Onslaught are looking like the scrappy underdogs trying to spoil the party. Even Sir Randy and his fancy Warden scouts are watching from the sidelines, probably wondering if their 'fancy bows' could ever match the raw power of a Trollball to the teeth!

Before the whistle, I caught a glimpse of some truly professional pre-game preparation! Milt Casady was leading Oak & Onslaught in a synchronized chant that grew so loud it nearly triggered a Rockslide early! Meanwhile, on the home side, Evalyn Pierrepont was meticulously polishing his helmet with a live snail! You can't make this stuff up, folks! And Northway Orran was striking theatrical poses that would make even God King Artorias jealous! Grab your grog and hold onto your hats, because this is playoff Trollball!
postGame:
What a game! What a spectacle! What a glorious display of bone-crunching mayhem! The underdogs have bitten back, folks! Oak & Onslaught walk into the Serpent's Pass and snatch Game 1 right out of the Bog Queen's hands! The final score stands at 3 to 2 in favor of the Wardens' favorites, and the Zmeigorod crowd is stunned into a silence so deep you could hear a snail crawl across Evalyn Pierrepont’s helmet!

The action started fast and mean! Kleinstein MacGregor scooped up that leather head early in Center Field, looking like she was ready to make a name for herself. But Milt Casady had other plans! He swung that blackjack with the grace of a seasoned executioner, sending Kleinstein to the dirt and into the medical tent! It was a beautiful sight, truly!

Not to be outdone, Hole Bowerman decided to join the fray! She lowered her lance and absolutely flattened Evalyn Pierrepont! The Snessengers were reeling early, their high popularity scores not doing a lick of good against the cold, hard wood of the Wardens' weaponry. Rose Kluge tried to get some momentum going with a pass, but it was as wild as a drunken pixie and hit the turf with a thud!

Then came the breakthrough! Wynnie Faina, wearing his boots on the wrong feet for luck, showed us why he's a star! He snagged the ball, dodged the defense, and charged into the End Zone for a thunderous dunk! The away fans went wild, and Oak & Onslaught took the lead! But they weren't finished yet, oh no!

Normi Glaudia decided he didn't feel like running all the way to the basket. From right there in Center Field, he wound up and launched a Shoot that sailed through the goal like a shooting star! Two points! Just like that, the score was 3 to zero, and the Snessengers looked like they were sinking faster than their own stadium!

Zmeigorod tried to rally, bless their hearts. Delija Dowling made a valiant run, and Gere Cordelie managed to land a spectacular Shoot from Home Field just after the halftime break to bring them back within striking distance! It was a 3 to 2 game and the tension was thick enough to cut with a Kriegsmesser!

But the defense from the Onslaught was just too brutal! Teria Ravo and Affra Yanaton were handing out injuries like they were participation trophies! They took turns knocking Northway Orran and Evalyn Pierrepont out of the game again! It’s a miracle anyone was left standing to play the ball!

Millham Evangeline was a one-demon wrecking crew in the closing minutes! They tackled Alded Sanjay and Arni Griffith back-to-back, sending both Snessengers to the healer with bells ringing in their ears! Even when the Snessengers tried to shoot from distance, the altitude and the pressure got to them, with both Arni and Kleinstein missing wide!

The game ended in a frantic scramble in the Away Field with Dare Wynnie desperately clutching the ball, but time simply ran out! The Zmeigorod Snessengers fall at home, and now they face a must-win situation in Game 2 or they'll be headed straight to the loser's bracket!

So, take that, you 'heroes' of the Grove! Valos the Eternal might think she rules the swamp, but today, she just rules a patch of dirt where her team got stomped! Oak & Onslaught takes a 1-0 lead in this Best of 3! I’m Nok the Corrupter, and I can’t wait to see who loses a limb next week! Goodnight, Osterra!
